title: Online Learning Data Exploration Using Predictive Video Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of online learning platform usage and foundational social studies concepts
context.additional_context: Students simultaneously engage in real-time classes and recorded lecture content via personal devices, utilizing video interaction data from major platforms (e.g., Google Classroom) for analysis. Aims to strengthen data literacy within social studies curricula.

learning_goals: Learners can explain correlations between learning patterns and performance by analyzing video playback records (pauses, rewinds, etc.)
Learners can predict at-risk learners using simple machine learning models (e.g., random forest) applied to video viewing data
Learners can propose personalized learning strategies based on predictive analytics and evaluate their effectiveness

resources: Video Interaction Data Visualization Tool (Tableau Public)
Simple Machine Learning Model-Building Platform (Orange/Teachable Machine)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
